trans-unit.target:
君！ 収穫を手伝ってくれないか！急がないと大切な果実をオポオポに取られてしまうよ！<tab>収穫を手伝いますか？
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※このF.A.T.E.の推奨レベルは<var 20 E802 /var>です。<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var><tab><tab><tab>頼んだよ！<tab><tab>そうかい。じゃあ、ほかの人に頼むよ。<tab>
果実を持ってきてくれたのかい？<tab><tab><tab><tab>ありがとう！<tab><tab>おや、違うのかい。<tab>
果実を集めて持ってきてくれ！<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>

Vile poachers! They seek to hide their trophies so that they might return and collect them once we have gone.<tab>We must stop them at any cost! Please, good <var 08 E905 ((lady)) ((sir)) /var>. Lend us your blade!<tab>Assist in recovering the poached hides?
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※The recommended level for this FATE is <var 20 E802 /var>.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var><tab><tab>Good luck, and may the Matron bless you!<tab><tab>Very well. We shall see to this task on our own.<tab>

Were you able to recover any of the poached hides?<tab><tab><tab><tab>You have my thanks, adventurer, but there may still be more poachers in the area.<tab><tab>The area is still crawling with poachers. See if you cannot find them before they escape!<tab>
Hurry, adventurer! We must recover the hides before the poachers can hide them!<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>

Filthy goblins! I merely stopped to relieve myself behind one of these trees, only to find my wares missing when I returned!<tab>I am but a humble merchant, untrained in the ways of battle. Might I ask of your assistance in reclaiming my livelihood? I shall make it worth your while.<tab>Assist in reclaiming the stolen merchandise?
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※The recommended level for this FATE is <var 20 E802 /var>.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var><tab><tab>Show them what it means to cross an Ul'dahn!<tab><tab>I shall remember this act of unkindness, adventurer!<tab>

Were my wares unharmed?<tab><tab><tab><tab>Yes, but there was more... Much more. I beg of thee, return to me what is rightfully mine!<tab><tab>Then why are you here talking with me!? Find my crates!<tab>
Make haste before the goblins make away with my crates!<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>

That big rock ye have there be takin' up an awful lot o' space in yer bag, like. Might be that I could take it off yer hands.<tab>Give the golem fragment to the prospector?<tab><tab><tab>Aye... This'll do jus' nicely. If ye happen upon any more, I'll be here a-waitin'.<tab><tab>And what do <var 1A 02 /var>you<var 1A 01 /var> need with that ol' rock anywise?<tab>

Ye see how them golem stones is drawn to one another like a crow is to carrion? I reckon it's 'cause the stones is carryin' metal within.<tab>Fetch me a few fragments and I'll prove it!<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>
Yes, this should be more than enough.<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>
My scouts report no more poachers in the area. This will have to do for now. You have my thanks, adventurer.<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>
One... Two... Three... I could have sworn I carried more... Oh, well. That is of no matter. I shall merely increase my prices!<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>
Heh heh. I'll be takin' these fragments back to me cabin now. And don't ye think of followin' me now, either!<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>

I...uh... Excuse me...<tab>I'm supposed to be participating in a group training exercise for Order of the Twin Adder recruits...but my party is short a...few members, and...<tab>Would you mind joining me? It would only be for a few moments.<tab>Join the serpent recruit?
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※The recommended level for this FATE is <var 20 E802 /var>.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var><tab><tab><tab>If there was only a simple and convenient way to search for a party...<tab>

If I never see a tree slug again it will be too soon!<tab>The repugnant creatures come down from the sentinels to feed on all the flowers, then retreat to the treetops before we can slice off their slimy heads.<tab>There's only so much a beekeeper can do...but you! A mere slug (or thirty) wouldn't be a match for <var 1A 02 /var>your<var 1A 01 /var> skill and cunning. What do you say?<tab>Assist the beekeepers?
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※The recommended level for this FATE is <var 20 E802 /var>.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var><tab>Oh, and just in time, as well! Look, here they come!<tab><tab>Without any flowers, how will our bees make any honey...?<tab>
Please! You must slay the slugs! Think of the bees!<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>

You! You must do something about that besotted brute! He's out of control!<tab>There's a good reason they call him Spenser of the Bottomless Cup. I don't believe the sot's been sober a day in his life.<tab>And now he's taken a fancy to pounding in the face of any poor sod who happens to even breathe in his direction...myself included. I beg you, put the pissed tosspot in his place!<tab>Deal with Spenser?
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※The recommended level for this FATE is <var 20 E802 /var>.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var><tab><tab><tab>Then who ever will save us!?<tab>
I don't know how much more of this I can take!<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>
Enter Redbelly Hive?<tab>Pass through the gates?<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>

Our scouts report that goblin merchants have met with a band of poachers at a nearby camp to parley the sale of unlawfully obtained hides.<tab>The talks, however, do not seem to be going well, as the two parties have begun fighting. This provides us with the perfect opportunity to strike two birds with one stone.<tab>Good adventurer. Would you assist my unit in our ambush of the outlaws?<tab>Aid the Wood Wailers?
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※The recommended level for this FATE is <var 20 E802 /var>.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var><tab>Excellent. Hurry to the campsite while there is still chaos.<tab><tab>And so you would sit idly by and allow these malefactors to defile the forest? I will never understand you adventurers...<tab>
Let these outlaws know there is no place for them in our forest!<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>
調子にのったキキルンの闇商人どもが偽造品を売り歩いているらしい。（仮）<tab>これ以上被害者を増やさないためにも、やつらが持っている偽造品を回収してきてくれないか？（仮）<tab>偽造品を回収してきますか？（仮）<tab><tab>よし、頼んだぞ！（仮）<tab><tab>仕方ない、残念だ。（仮）<tab>
やつらから偽造品を回収してきたのか？（仮）<tab><tab><tab><tab>よくやった。また見つけたら持ってきてくれ。（仮）<tab><tab>そうか、見つけたらすぐ持ってきてくれ。（仮）<tab>
闇商人どもが持っている偽造品を回収してきてくれ！（仮）<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>
これだけ回収すれば、しばらくやつらの商売もあがったりだろう。（仮）<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>

An adventurer! Oh, I never thought I'd be so happy to see one of your lot!<tab>It's those damnable imps! Not only are they pinching the honey from all our hives, but they're killing the precious bees in the process.<tab>Please, you must lend us your blade!<tab>Aid the beekeepers?
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※The recommended level for this FATE is <var 20 E802 /var>.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var><tab><tab><tab>Think of all the unruly tosspots who'll venture out into the forest if they don't get their mead! Please reconsider!<tab>

The oranges are all picked and boxed. Now I need only wait for the caravan to come pick them up...<tab>The problem is, the caravan is nowhere in sight, and I can already hear the rats clawing their way out from under the rocks. It won't be long before they've found their way into the crates.<tab>I beg of you, <var 08 E905 ((good lady)) ((good sir)) /var>! Would you help me in keeping the rats clear of my oranges until the chocobos arrive?<tab>Aid the farmer?
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※The recommended level for this FATE is <var 20 E802 /var>.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var><tab><tab><tab>Another harvest lost, then...<tab>

Listen carefully, adventurer. Qiqirn bandits have kidnapped several Highbridge residents and are looking to sell them off to the Amalj'aa for tempering.<tab>Once a person has been tempered, the soul is lost and the body transformed into an empty husk which answers only to the commands of the primal Ifrit.<tab>We must stop this foul dealing and rescue the villagers before they are taken back to the Bowl of Embers.<tab>Will you help?
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※The recommended level for this FATE is <var 20 E802 /var>.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var><tab><tab><tab>Then the Brass Blades shall fight alone.<tab>

Listen up! A series of live Maelstrom training exercises will begin in less than half a bell.<tab>A batch of fresh recruits will more than likely be making a sorry attempt to defend the checkpoint here against a mock imperial assault.<tab>If you wish, you are welcome to join the recruits. Hells, with you at the fore, the greenbacks just might learn something about teamwork.<tab>Join the exercise?
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※The recommended level for this FATE is <var 20 E802 /var>.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var><tab><tab><tab>Then I must ask you to stand clear. I won't have spectators distracting my men.<tab>

Twelve take me! If it ain't a real live 'venturer! I could use some help, if it's help you're profferin'?<tab>You see, I'm tasked with tillin' the orchards so that the roots of these here trees might breathe better, like. But it seems each an' ev'ry step I take is straight into a damned molehill.<tab>I've already gone an' lamed me left leg, and cannae 'ford to lame me right, so I was thinkin' I could get meself a true 'venturer to whack the bloody moles one good. What do you say?<tab>Whack away?
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※The recommended level for this FATE is <var 20 E802 /var>.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var><tab>Me da was right! You can always trust a 'venturer to right the wrongs of this world. But enough of me yappin', now get to whackin'!<tab><tab>Me da was right... You can't trust a 'venturer farther than you can kick one.<tab>
Me da said the best place to whack a mole is straight upside his head.<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>

Please, you must help me. I am being hunted by the Amalj'aa, and if they catch me, they <var 1A 02 /var>will<var 1A 01 /var> kill me.<tab>You see, I was tasked with infiltrating Zanr'ak and stealing their battle plans, but I was caught and taken to the Bowl of Embers for tempering. However, I managed to escape when the carriage transporting me and the other slaves slipped off the road.<tab>Though I have had somewhat of a head start, it took their battle drakes little time to pick up my scent, and now a party of pursuers is only a matter of malms away. I must get to the aetheryte at Little Ala Mhigo so I might relay my findings to the flame commander, but do not believe I can make it on my own.<tab>Escort the scout to Little Ala Mhigo?
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※The recommended level for this FATE is <var 20 E802 /var>.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var><tab><tab><tab>Then you have sentenced me to death...or worse, tempering.<tab>

A moment of your time, <var 08 E905 ((milady)) ((milord)) /var>?<tab>The fields are crawling with ocean roselings─horrible creatures that choke out the crops and maim the tillers who tend to them. We hold our own against the seedkin, but it seems for every one we cut down, there are three more to take its place!<tab>We'd be obliged if you could lend us your sword in clearing the fields.<tab>Aid the tillers?
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※The recommended level for this FATE is <var 20 E802 /var>.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var><tab>That's right kind of you, <var 08 E905 ((milady)) ((milord)) /var>. You see? Here they come now!<tab><tab>Apologies, <var 08 E905 ((milady)) ((milord)) /var>. I reckon you have matters of greater import what need attendin'.<tab>
Did I not tell you? Three more for every one slain. If only my crops grew so well!<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>

Why!? Why, I ask you!<tab>Why would galagos want anything to do with my flour!? It's not as if they can bake it into bread or lemoncakes! They can't, can they?<tab>But that doesn't stop them from raiding my granaries day in and day out. If this goes on much longer, I will have nothing to take to market and the moneylenders will come for my only daughter... Please! I beg of you! Help me drive off the beasts!<tab>Aid the miller?
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※The recommended level for this FATE is <var 20 E802 /var>.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var><tab>A thousand thanks! A thousand thousand thanks! If only I could find the words to thank you enou─ Oh! They're here!<tab><tab>Perhaps another will come along who can help...<tab>

Bloody cane toads! The scholarlies down at Mealvaan's Gate reckoned they would eat the locusts which overrun the wheat fields each year, and so allowed a crate of the slimy creatures to be released into lower La Noscea.<tab>Not only did they not eat the locusts, but they began breedin' quicker 'an rabbits, and before we knew it, the whole damn region was burstin' at the seams with the ugly monsters.<tab>Now, I spend my days catchin' and guttin' the toads at the behest of the same damned scholarlies who started this whole mess. It ain't a bad job, but it sure can be right lonely sometimes. Hey, you wouldn't mind keepin' a man company, would you?<tab>That's a good <var 08 E905 ((lass)) ((lad)) /var>. Now off you go while I stand watch here and make sure no one from the road bothers us.<tab>Eh? You thought we was going to do the guttin' together? That's rich!<tab><tab><tab>

Bloody cane toads! The scholarlies down at Mealvaan's Gate reckoned they would eat the locusts which overrun the wheat fields each year, and so allowed a crate of the slimy creatures to be released into lower La Noscea.<tab>Now, I spend my days catchin' and guttin' the toads at the behest of the same damned scholarlies who started this whole mess. It ain't a bad job, but it sure can be right lonely sometimes. Hey, you wouldn't mind keepin' an man company, would you?<tab>Spend your day catchin' and guttin'?
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※The recommended level for this FATE is <var 20 E802 /var>.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var><tab><tab>That's a good <var 08 E905 ((lass)) ((lad)) /var>. Now off you go while I stand watch here and make sure no one from the road bother us. Eh? You thought we was going to do the guttin' together? That's rich!<tab><tab>Then leave me be. I've toads to gut.<tab>

参ったな……またヤーゾンが集まってきやがった。 やつら、杭打ち機に巣を作ろうとするんだよ。<tab>こうなると作業になんなくてね。 すまないが、ヤーゾンの駆除を手伝ってくれないか？<tab>引き受けますか？
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※このF.A.T.E.の推奨レベルは<var 20 E802 /var>です。<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var><tab><tab>助かるよ。 やつら、そこの木の辺りに集まってきてる。 杭打ち機に寄り付く前に、倒してくれ！<tab><tab>そうか……。急いで他を当たらないとな。<tab>

Cores... Cannot drive the piles without earth sprite cores...<tab>Cores harden the land... Help the piles take hold... Have you any cores?<tab>Gather cores for the hammer workers?
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※The recommended level for this FATE is <var 20 E802 /var>.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var><tab><tab>Cores...lying about... Cores...flying about...<tab><tab>Cores...<tab>

You there. Did the Consortium send you? No? Well, that is of no matter. You are here now, and now you shall help me. Agreed?<tab>The lawless thugs who squat there in that ramshackle manse have stolen my precious cargo and I require you to retrieve it. Not too daunting a task for someone of your obvious talents, I presume?<tab>Aid the merchant?
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※The recommended level for this FATE is <var 20 E802 /var>.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var><tab><tab>Very good, very good. Now make haste. I have tea planned with a noble lady not long from now and it would not do well if I were late.<tab><tab>Perhaps you mistook my order for a choice?<tab>

Thal's balls! I don't know whether to slit the throats of them goblins, or them what kicked the buggers out of Ul'dah and into Hammerlea!<tab>Now the thrice-damned runts are running about buggerin' up my supplies for the hammers, and I haven't the means to stop them. Now if I had me an adventurer...<tab>Lend the worker a hand?
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※The recommended level for this FATE is <var 20 E802 /var>.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var><tab><tab>Give the little shites no quarter. That'll learn 'em.<tab><tab>Ah, I forgot. It's coin what does the talkin', eh? Well, I have more than enough for the <var 08 E905 ((woman)) ((man)) /var> what does in them gobbies.<tab>

Me da... Et by a 'bon, he were.<tab>Now I wants 'em all dead, like. Wiv crossy eyes like them as drawed in the picture shows. Da used to take me to the picture shows...before he was et. By a 'bon.<tab>Kill some 'bons?
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※The recommended level for this FATE is <var 20 E802 /var>.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var><tab><tab>Don't get et!<tab><tab><whimper> One day, I'll be big enough to kill me own 'bon! Jus' you wait!<tab>

An adventurer, are you? Well, you'll have to do.<tab>You see that man over there? The big one. The captain of a shipping vessel out of Radz<var 1F /var>at<var 1F /var>Han found him stowed away belowdecks. When the captain moored here at the Quay, we brought the brute ashore for questioning...<tab>...when he up and started assailing my men! And for a man who's been holed up in a dark corner for the past fortnight, he has more energy than you'd believe. We could certainly use a hand in calming him down.<tab>Aid the Quay guards?
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※The recommended level for this FATE is <var 20 E802 /var>.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var><tab><tab><tab>Aye... I shan't judge you for your decision. No <var 08 E905 ((woman)) ((man)) /var> in their right mind would want to dance with that <var 1A 02 /var>thing<var 1A 01 /var>.<tab>
Cores...?<tab><tab><tab><tab>Cores...<tab><tab>You bring cores...I bring coin... Simple...<tab>

Have you retrieved my crates yet? I have an appointment, you know. One with a noble lady. There will be tea.<tab><tab><tab><tab>Is this all? I could have sworn there were more. Countless more. Yes. Now back into the breach, my good <var 08 E905 ((lady)) ((fellow)) /var>.<tab><tab>What are you waiting for!? The tea! It grows ever colder!<tab>
Cores...<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>
I do not have the time for this. Tea and noble ladies await! Didn't I mention this?<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>

You seem the able adventurer. I must cross the desert to Forgotten Springs with these relics unearthed here at the Strike, but cannot well defend myself with my hands full.<tab>You see, the seemingly lifeless desert is actually teeming with creatures who wait under the sand for their victims to hap upon their traps. And then there are the Amalj'aa...<tab>So, what say you? Guide me safely to Forgotten Springs and I shall see to it that you are handsomely rewarded.<tab>Escort the Stone Torch?
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※The recommended level for this FATE is <var 20 E802 /var>.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var><tab><tab><tab>Well then. I suppose my clients will have to wait.<tab>

I swear, each batch of recruits the Barracudas send me is worse than the last. I've already had to send three home because <var 1A 02 /var>they wouldn't stop crying<var 1A 01 /var>.<tab>If only I had more <var 08 E905 ((women)) ((men)) /var> like you. Ones with sharp blades, and the wits to match.<tab>I know. How about you show these yellow-bellied greenbacks how a true warrior fights? I'll make it worth your while.<tab>Crack the whip?
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※The recommended level for this FATE is <var 20 E802 /var>.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var><tab>Hah hah hah! You hear that, scrags? Prepare to have your arses handed to you on a silver bleedin' platter. Now fall in!<tab><tab><sigh> I suppose they wouldn't have offered much of a challenge anywise.<tab>

Thank the Twelve you came along when you did!<tab>Anselm and Fiebras are at each other's throats again! It's that damned ale wench. Both fancy the lass, and neither is willing to stand aside so that the other may have her...though, truth be told, the wench despises both, and only humors them because it is her job to do so.<tab>The two are good lads...when not in their cups, but I fear that their lust for this girl will end in one of them dead! I have already tried calming them with words, but to no avail. This leaves us with but one solution─steel.<tab>Beat the violence out of the two?
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※The recommended level for this FATE is <var 20 E802 /var>.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var><tab><tab><tab>This will not end well... You have sentenced a man to death today. Let that sit well on your conscience.<tab>

That woman didn't best me. I merely came unprepared.<tab>I didn't think when I left my bed this morning that some slighted scold with a peiste-sized chip on her shoulder might challenge me to a bloody duel. But I wasn't about to refuse her...not with everyone watching and my reputation on the line. If I ain't one thing, it's craven.<tab>But here I am. Bloodied and bruised while that hells-cat sits over there smirking. What she did ain't proper and I plan on learnin' her a lesson. Just, this time with a wee bit of help. What say you?<tab>Challenge Grishild the Ungood?
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※The recommended level for this FATE is <var 20 E802 /var>.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var><tab><tab><tab>You aren't craven, are you?<tab>
Hear ye! The Maelstrom is conducting a live training exercise at the De Nevelle Checkpoint. All adventurers are welcome to join.<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>
You look to be well-seasoned <var 08 E905 ((lass)) ((lad)) /var>. Would you care to show this batch of yellow-bellied greenbacks a thing or two about battlecraft?<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>
I beg of you, <var 08 E905 ((good lady)) ((good sir)) /var>! Might you help me keep these damnable rats clear of my oranges until the chocobo caravan arrives?<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>
Galagos! Galagos! How am I to deliver my wheat to market when the Grey Fleet is overrun with...with...galagos!?<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>
The yarzons won't have the Hammers! Not if I can help it!<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>
If those cursed goblins lay a hand on me cogs I'll...I'll... Well, I'll think of somethin'!<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>
The orobon are at it again! We cannot let them eat any more of the younger fish, or there'll be naught left for next season's catch!<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>
Me da... Et by a 'bon, he were. Now I wants the fishes all dead, like. Can ye make 'em all dead, like?<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>

Ah, an adventurer. And one with fire in <var 08 E905 ((her)) ((his)) /var> eyes, no less. That fire is just what we need.<tab>Spurred by rumors of a new Amalj'aa commander, I arrived outside the beast tribe encampment to find not only that the commander had arrived, but that the foul lizards were preparing to march on Ul'dah!<tab>A request for reinforcements has already been sent via linkshell, but it will be several bells before they arrive, and by then it will be too late. No, we must stop the enemy before they advance, and since we are sorely outnumbered, I believe the only path to victory is to lower morale by targeting both their supplies and their leader.<tab>Aid the Immortal Flames?
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※The recommended level for this FATE is <var 20 E802 /var>.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var><tab><tab><tab>Then I suggest you leave this area immediately, for it will soon be engulfed in chaos.<tab>

I was right! Stand in the desert long enough, and an adventurer is bound to come calling. So, can one assume you are looking for employment? I am a naturalist studying the magicked aura emitted from the Sunken Temple of Qarn, and I believe this aura is what powers those stone golems which guard the entrance.<tab>If I can learn to disrupt that aura, I may be able to render all the guardians inactive, opening the ruins for further exploration by scholars such as myself. But to do so, I first require the hearts of those very guardians, so I may study how they operate.<tab>Collect soulstones for the naturalist?
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※The recommended level for this FATE is <var 20 E802 /var>.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var><tab><tab>Oh, I knew my plan would work!<tab><tab>You would forsake a woman in need? What would the good people of the Adventurers' Guild say to that!?<tab>
Inside each stone guardian is a soulstone which animates the lifeless rock. I need these stones so I might learn how to extinguish the flames of life within.<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>

You have brought me something, have you not?<tab><tab><tab><tab>The... The light... It burns so brightly, yet emits no heat. What sort of fell magicks am I witnessing here...? Oh, my apologies. Yes, very good. This specimen will do just fine, but I would not turn away a <var 08 E905 ((woman)) ((man)) /var> who brought me more.<tab><tab>But why!? You are a mere adventurer. You cannot expect to fathom the complex mysteries of the soulstones' inner workings! You must entrust them to me! To me!<tab>

Please, <var 08 E905 ((ma'am)) ((sir)) /var>. My baby brother is hungry, but my mother is too weak to feed him. My father left before I reached my third nameday, and my grandfather died last week in Copperbell Mines. My sister moved away to a rich merchant's house and no longer visits us, and my older brother lies all day in the corner with his somnus pipe... If you could spare some food...<tab>Even the leaves of a cactus would suffice...<tab>Help the poor girl?
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※The recommended level for this FATE is <var 20 E802 /var>.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var><tab><tab>May the Twelve bless you!<tab><tab><sob> Back to the pub again, then...<tab>
Please! My baby brother will starve without something to eat! Anything will do. Even the leaves of a cactus!<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>
Did you find any leaves?<tab><tab><tab><tab>Thank you! But please, <var 08 E905 ((ma'am)) ((sir)) /var>. Can I have some more?<tab><tab>But my baby brother!<tab>

You there. Might you be the escort Master Gegeruju promised?<tab>My...ah, client awaits me at Hidden Falls and I grow weary in this heat.<tab>I also believe there might be someone following me─a common enough nuisance for one in my...ah, line of work.<tab>Escort the lady?
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※The recommended level for this FATE is <var 20 E802 /var>.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var><tab><tab><tab>You're <var 1A 02 /var>not<var 1A 01 /var> the escort? Then you're lucky I don't charge you for the time we've spent here chatting.<tab>

Not a quarter moon passes without some feeble attempt by the local Qiqirn to raid Highbridge and steal the supplies which are ferried in regularly by airship.<tab>This is why we Brass Blades stand constant vigil. It is our duty to ensure that the citizens of the settlement can carry out their tasks without fear of being attacked.<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>

Highbridge has its dangers, what with the Qiqirn and the Amalj'aa always lookin' to claim the span as their own...<tab>But one man's hardship is another's opportunity. I look to make a killin' here, what with all the other merchants huddlin' together in safer locales as Drybone and the Golden Bazaar.<tab>And while they sit there splittin' profits, I'll be linin' me coffers with gold...as long as the Brass Blades keep the peace, that is.<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>

Unlike that chatty peddler o'er yonder, I'm not fool enough to believe a motley crew of hired swords can stop the beast tribes from overrunning the span.<tab>It's only a matter of time before they succeed in spiriting away a few of our children again. Yes, you heard me right. It's not only supplies those damned rats seek.<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>
Another victory under the captain's belt!<tab>And there are quite a few victories under there. I know. I've seen them.<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>

My unit is not unlike a machine.<tab>Each part interlocking, and running best when well oiled...if you know what I mean.<tab>If you're looking to join, well, then I'm afraid I must disappoint. Another hand on the lever is the last thing I need.<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>
The captain sometimes allows me to operate his lever.<tab>Says I'm a right engineer, he does.<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>

For people arriving in Thanalan from the Black Shroud, Highbridge is the first town they arrive in. For people leaving Thanalan, Highbridge is the last town they will see before entering the dark forest.<tab>Not many places can lay claim to both new beginnings and bitter ends.<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>

Welcome to Highbridge. We are one of only a handful of towns that has its own airship landing.<tab>Though it appears to have been cut over centuries, the canyon in which the Yugr'am River flows was actually formed five summers past during the great Calamity. The bridge was built immediately after to reconnect the Royal Allagan Sunway with the Lumberline leading to Gridania.<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>

I'm sorry, but the airships which frequent Highbridge are reserved for the transport of supplies and the occasional naturalist from Arrzaneth Ossuary come to study the ruins of the Invisible City.<tab>If it is airship passage you seek, might I suggest the landings in Ul'dah or Gridania?<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>

Listen! Can you hear them? The screams rising up from the bottom of the canyon!<tab>The Blades all tell me it's naught but the wind, but I've heard the wailing on nights where nary a leaf shuddered. Soon, they'll believe me. When the army of undead marches from the Invisible City and reclaims our realm for their own!<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>
Gone... Everything stolen by those rats.<tab>How could we have allowed this to happen... We shan't let our guard down again. I swear it on my honor!<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>

Lever, lever, lever! Is that all he can think about? People were taken from their families! Livelihoods destroyed!<tab>If the captain weren't just so handsome, I'd leave him this instant!<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>
It appears my well-oiled machine...malfunctioned.<tab>Perhaps the lever requires a tad more jostling. And oil. Much more oil.<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>
Did we lose?<tab>Well, then I suppose tonight he'll be wanting to recalibrate his lever.<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>

Oh, what ever can I do!? This mead must be delivered to the Sanctum of the Twelve before the rite, or the monsignor will have my ar─ Ah, my head. He'll have my head!<tab>But with all these gnats circling about, attracted to the sweet smell of the honey, I'll never make it to the sanctuary in one piece!<tab>Would it be too much trouble to ask you to escort me? I could pay you with part of what the monsignor gave me.<tab>Escort the courier?
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※The recommended level for this FATE is <var 20 E802 /var>.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var><tab><tab><tab>Well, I suppose the sting of a gnat is less excruciating than the punishment waiting me if this mead does not arrive on time...<tab>
We dinnae force this life upon a single man. Those what could not resist the call o' the Deep left us lubbers long ago, and I wish 'em naught but the best.<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>
If the Admiral wants to believe that we Salthounds've righted the rudder and straightened the ship by reclaimin' the mill, let the fool.<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>
No coin, no loot. Just a rottin' mill and slugs to break me fast on.<tab>Might be as I should raid me that rat-run tradin' post on yonder.<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>
The cap'n says no rum till the mill's runnin' proper, like. Good thing I still keeps me that bottle 'idden by the falls.<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>
Damn the cap'n all the way to the Seventh Gate and back! This bloody mill is beyond mendin'. It should be torn down and used to build another ship!<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>

We Salthounds lost our ship and 'alf the bloody crew when the sky fell five summers past. If it weren't fer the cap'n, I suppose most of us'd still be reavin', but as scrags with other crews.<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>

Ye see the Lala off sittin' by 'er lonesome? That be our trusty cap'n. 'Twas 'er notion we should see this mill up an' runnin'.<tab>Why a mill? I's learned in me years as a pirate there be one thing ye ne'er do, and that be question the cap'n.<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>

I's 'ad me my share o' maids back durin' me reavin' days, which is why I agreed to follow the cap'n up 'ere to this forsaken piss pit.<tab>But lo, do ye sees yerself a single blushin' beauty amongst these 'ere roots an' vines? I's been cozened, I 'as.<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>

Not a single drop o' blood was shed in the takin' o' the mill. By the time we'd arrived, the place 'ad already been long abandoned. Though, if it 'adn't, I reckon the tale might've been different.<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>

Some o' these men still revel in the tales o' their exploits on the five seas. Me? I loathed the Deep. A woman as me could get nary a night's rest, what with the constant croakin' an' rockin'.<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>

I once slit the throat of an island king, took 'is daughters, and burned 'is village. The loot I plundered that day saw me belly filled with rum for a moon. And now, 'ere I am, dancin' in the shrubs. So, if ye thinks I look 'appy, yer blinder than a one-eyed crone.<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>

The crew's been 'ere nigh on three summers, but we've little to show for it. Every time we make e'en an ilm of 'eadway, some new creature crawls from the forest to come kick our arses back down.<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>
The cap'n keeps tellin' us our day, she'll come. I's naught better to do with me time, so wait, I shall.<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>
Cuttin' a throat is easy─it's the gettin' to it that be 'ard. Gettin' to a tree is easy. Now, the cuttin'...<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>
This 'ere be Salt'ound land. Scurry off afore we cut off yer limbs and use 'em to prop up our feet, like.<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>
I suppose yer wonderin' why I brought me 'ounds 'ere.<tab>Well, keep wonderin', 'cause I ain't tellin' no meddlin' 'venturer.<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>
Why does Master Gegeruju insist on making me wait?<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>
Perhaps a rose by any other name would smell just as sweet, but then again, it would not cost me as much coin.<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>

Since the Admiral and Mealvaan's Gate began implementing stricter import laws, clever pirates have taken to using goblins to distribute their contraband to the people of La Noscea, so that they may escape the hand of justice.<tab>One such pack of goblins has been discovered here in Skull Valley, and my men and I have been ordered to confiscate the goods and slay all those who fail to cooperate.<tab>We could use the help of a skilled adventurer such as yourself. And do not worry. You <var 1A 02 /var>will<var 1A 01 /var> be rewarded for your efforts. Your safety, on the other hand, I cannot guarantee. But such is any job, no?<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>

Silence! I would not have you disturb our mission to confiscate the contraband being hoarded by that band of goblins...<tab>Unless, that is, you wish to join.<tab>In that case, you are free to infiltrate the goblin camp and retrieve as many crates as you can lift. The ones being carried by the goblins themselves may require a tad more...coercing.<tab>Join the operation?
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※The recommended level for this FATE is <var 20 E802 /var>.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var><tab>You have our thanks, adventurer. I have an urgent request, but only if you are bound for Tidegate.<tab>I must deliver important orders from the Admiral herself to the Maelstrom commander stationed at South Tidegate, but the storm privates assigned to accompany me have yet to arrive. For all I know they could be lying drunk in a gutter somewhere. I don't believe we will encounter much trouble, but I've been known to be wrong on countless occasions.<tab>Escort the scout?
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※The recommended level for this FATE is <var 20 E802 /var>.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var><tab><tab><tab>I see. Very well then. Till sea swallows all.<tab>

Lemons! I <var 1A 02 /var>hate<var 1A 01 /var> lemons! I <var 1A 02 /var>despise<var 1A 01 /var> lemons! I <var 1A 01 /var>loathe<var 1A 01 /var> lemons!<tab>Look at this ankle! You...wouldn't happen to be heading in that direction, now...would you? I could use a sturdy shoulder to lean upon.<tab>Escort the merchant to Vesper Bay?
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※The recommended level for this FATE is <var 20 E802 /var>.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var><tab><tab><tab>I suppose you think all this is amusing. A man attacked by a savage lemon rind. Go on. Laugh it up. Let us hear you now.<tab>
Enough cores... But can never have truly enough cores...<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>
Cores...? Can never have too many cores...<tab><tab><tab><tab>Core... This will...serve nicely...<tab><tab>Very well...<tab>
Thank you! Now I won't have to go back to the pub and dance for that sour-smelling man. <shudder><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>

You... You want to give me more?<tab><tab><tab><tab>Oh thank you! My baby brother will be so happy...if my older brother doesn't take the leaves and sell them for more somnus...<tab><tab>Do you have a baby brother, too?<tab>
Yes, I believe everything is in order. It seems I will be having tea after all! Oh, what a glorious day!<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>

You mean to tell me, there were still crates in the manse?<tab><tab><tab><tab>By golly, you were right! My mind must have been somewhere else. In Ul'dah. Sipping on tea, I suppose.<tab><tab>Of course not! I have all my crates right here! Silly adventurer.<tab>

This should be more than a sufficient amount of soulstones. Why, I could light my bedchamber for mon─ I mean, discover <var 1A 02 /var>myriad<var 1A 01 /var> secrets! Yes.<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>

I have more than enough soulstones to conduct my research, but I won't turn away those who are willing to bring more.<tab><tab><tab><tab>Excellent! My colleagues will never mock me again!<tab><tab>Well, you know where to find me! (Hopefully the guardians do not.)<tab>

I beg of you, <var 08 E905 ((milady)) ((milord)) /var>! I'm but a poor collector of shells, looking to feed her family.<tab>But the rainbowlip oysters that I sell for a gil a dozen to the kind Lalafell in Costa del Sol are all being eaten by the dreadful colibri.<tab>The savvy little devils follow me and wait until I have found a shell, then swoop in from behind and snatch it from my basket! Try as I might to retrieve them, the birds are much too quick for me to catch. If someone were to help, I would be eternally in their debt!<tab>Help collect shells?
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※The recommended level for this FATE is <var 20 E802 /var>.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var><tab>Praise the Twelve! I shall wait here for you.<tab><tab>My sons... They won't last much longer on sandfleas and seawater.<tab>

Might those be rainbowlip oysters you carry!?<tab><tab><tab><tab>Oh, I cannot thank you enough! Unless you were to bring me more. Then I would thank you again!<tab><tab>If left in the colibri's bellies too long, the shells will lose all their luster and the kind Lalafell in Costa del Sol will refuse to buy them.<tab>
Tonight my sons and I dine on the finest dodo beaks and pelican feet!<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>

How goes the search for contraband?<tab><tab><tab><tab>Remarkable. To think that there are respectable people in La Noscea who would purchase this filth... The operation is nearly complete.<tab>There are still a few moments before we pack up these crates and deliver them to the custom house for inspection and incineration. If you happen upon any more contraband in that time, please let us know.<tab><tab><tab>Very good. I shall add these items to the others. Your contribution has been duly noted.<tab><tab><tab>

No Qiqirn allowed. No exceptions. You ain't a Qiqirn, are you?<tab>No. If you were, I'd smell it.<tab>Might be you could help me, though. A pack of the rats is fixin' to sneak its way in and steal our wine. How do I know? Because they try just about every godsdamned day.<tab>Help the heavy?
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※The recommended level for this FATE is <var 20 E802 /var>.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var><tab><tab><tab>Forget it, then.<tab>

You there! Yes, you there! My unit has abandoned me, and I sit here cold and bleeding. Might I convince you to spare a few moments of your time clearing the area of a few...ah, <var 1A 02 /var>small<var 1A 01 /var> pests up about Monument Tower?<tab>I use the word “small” in a purely figurative sense, for the pests I refer to are actually quite <var 1A 02 /var>large<var 1A 01 /var>─“giant,” one might even say. So, then. Do you perhaps fancy yourself a slayer of giants?<tab>Fancy yourself a giant slayer?
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※The recommended level for this FATE is <var 20 E802 /var>.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var><tab><tab>Just the answer I was hoping to hear! Injuries be damned─your spirit has rekindled mine own! As you can clearly see, I am sorely undermanned.<tab>

Oh, thank the saints! You would <var 1A 02 /var>not<var 1A 01 /var> believe how long I have been standing here waiting for a <var 08 E905 ((woman)) ((man)) /var> of your ilk to happen by. Might I ask of you a favor?<tab>I am one of a cadre of researchers, scholars, and naturalists who go by the collective name “the Sons of Saint Coinach.” I am returning from a foray into the lowlands of Coerthas to collect supplies, but find the road back to our site of study overrun with terrible creatures who were not there on my way north.<tab>If you would be so kind as to lend me your talents in clearing the path and keeping my head securely attached to my shoulders, I would see to it that you are suitably rewarded.<tab>Escort the son of Saint Coinach?
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※The recommended level for this FATE is <var 20 E802 /var>.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var><tab><tab><tab>I suppose it was too much to ask... Well, I shan't think any less of you for your decision. We all have our priorities.<tab>

Please, good adventurer. I haven't much time. <var 1A 02 /var>They<var 1A 01 /var> are so close now... It is only a matter of time before they find me.<tab>Who, you ask? The wolves, who else? Can you not hear them? The rumble of their growl, the incessant pattering of their feet, and the howls... Those bloodcurdling howls... A pack has been on my trail since I wounded my leg in an iron trap intended for those very beasts. Oh, the irony of it all!<tab>I have used what little strength I have left to make it this far, but the wound has begun to ache, and I do not believe I can outrun the pack any longer. Please, I beg of you. Beat the wolves back just long enough that I might make it to Camp Dragonhead and the succor behind her walls.<tab>Escort the injured knight?
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※The recommended level for this FATE is <var 20 E802 /var>.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var><tab><tab><tab>Then you have damned me to death's cold grip...<tab>

<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※The recommended level for this FATE is <var 20 E802 /var>.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var><tab><tab><tab>Giant's <var 1A 02 /var>foot<var 1A 01 /var> my arse... Well met, brave adventurer. I beg your pardon, <var 08 E905 ((ma'am)) ((sir)) /var>. <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※The recommended level for this FATE is <var 20 E802 /var>.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var><tab><tab><tab>Is that any way to treat a fellow adventurer? What if <var 1A 02 /var>you<var 1A 01 /var> were stuck somewhere, arms bloodied and bruised from battling countless beasts, and needed someone to lend you a hand gathering abandoned equipment? Well, you wouldn't find any help from me!<tab>

They're all yours! I'll wait until the coast is clear before collecting the items. I, uh, wouldn't want to get in your way.<tab>Oh, and don't worry about those nixes outside the camp. I don't think they will be giving us any trouble.<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>

Well met! I hear tell there was some magitek contraption what caught aflame near these parts. I came looking to see if I couldn't take a few of the scraps back to the guild to study.<tab>Why would I do that, you ask? Now, if I only had some kind soul to help me. <wink> <wink><tab>Help the draughtsman collect engine parts?
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※The recommended level for this FATE is <var 20 E802 /var>.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var><tab>That's the spirit! How could this have happened! Tell me! TELL ME!<tab>Traps, nets, patrols day and night...and still those damnable Namazu are able to slither into our village and rob us of our very livelihoods! I've had enough! This means <var 1A 02 /var>war<var 1A 01 /var>! Not only will we retrieve the seedlings they stole, we will make sure they never can again!<tab>To war?
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※The recommended level for this FATE is <var 20 E802 /var>.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var><tab><tab>Good! Because you can't have a war without someone able to fight, and us poor, humble villagers are far from able when it comes to slitting throats and taking names. You, on the other hand, <var 1A 02 /var>you<var 1A 01 /var> look as if you've sent a good plenty of deserving souls to the afterlife. I'll be waiting here for the seedlings!<tab><tab>So it's like that, is it? You're going to leave us here to starve? I suppose we only have ourselves to blame...but it's a lot easier on the heart blaming an uncharitable stranger!<tab>

You have been mossst generousss with your time, kind stranger. Several of my creations still lie in the handsss of the accursssed Qalyana, but I have already asked overmuch, and could not think of burdening you further...unlesss, that is, you do not mind...<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>

My aunt tells me that adventurers are supposed to help people. Would you help <var 1A 02 /var>me<var 1A 01 /var> collect sharp stones to make arrowheads?<tab>Help the M tribe youth?
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※The recommended level for this FATE is <var 20 E802 /var>.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var><tab><tab><tab>You will? I... I... It's just...my aunt... She's never... Oh, thank you, good <var 08 E905 ((lady)) ((sir)) /var>! There are sharp stones all about these hills, but the best ones can be found inside the dhara's dust-devils.<tab><tab>I knew it. My aunt is always lying...when she's not giving me lashings.<tab>

Have you had any luck? The hills are thick with dhara this day and I'm afraid they'll find me if I leave this spot.<tab>Hand the youth the stones you have collected?<tab><tab><tab>Ow! When I said sharp stones, you truly listened! Many thanks, kind adventurer. You have saved me a lashing!<tab><tab>My aunt will be furious if I return with this few stones... But then, when isn't she furious?<tab>

Too many... Far, <var 1A 02 /var>far<var 1A 01 /var> too many...<tab>If there are as many eggs in the other hornbill nests as the one I just checked, come summer the fields will be aflood with the birds, all honking and squarking till the small hours of night. If you'd be as kind to help me fetch an egg or ten, the village would be in your debt.<tab>Collect eggs for the farmhand?
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※The recommended level for this FATE is <var 20 E802 /var>.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var><tab><tab>Your kindness has spared us many a sleepless night, stranger. You'll find the eggs strewn about the paddies, as well as on the hornbills themselves. The females are known to warm their eggs 'neath their wings when hunting.<tab><tab>Beg pardon. 'Twas wrong of me to ask, <var 08 E905 ((milady)) ((milord)) /var>. <tab>

The greedy Namazu made off with far more seedlings than they could carry. As such, some may be lying about the route they used to escape. To reclaim all of them, well... You'll need to find the thieves and <var 1A 02 /var>ask please<var 1A 01 /var>.<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>
There are sharp stones all about these hills, but the best ones can be found inside the dhara's dust-devils.<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>

The tribe is always in need of arrows, and you cannot make arrows without sharp stones. Might you have found more?<tab>Hand over the additional stones?<tab><tab><tab>Never before have I known such kindness. My only worry is that if I bring her this many stones, my aunt will think it some manner of treachery... I know, I can hide some of these extras away for next time!<tab><tab>They are quite good stones for making arrowheads. I can see why you'd want to keep them for yourself. It's not like it is <var 1A 02 /var>you<var 1A 01 /var> who will be getting twenty lashings when you return home empty-handed...<tab>
The more arrows you find, the fewer lashes my aunt will give me when I return home. You wouldn't want to see me lashed...would you?<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>

My thanksss, kind stranger. When I woke this morning I feared I would never see any of my creations again, and yet here you have brought me nearly all that were taken.<tab><tab><tab><tab>I could not asssk any more of you...unlesss, that is, you wish to bloody your blade once more in the name of justice...<tab><tab>Those beads were not carved for you and your ilk. They will bring you no fortune. They will bring you no strength.<tab>

You here to aid the Resistance? I know it's not as glamorous as trading blows with an imperial centurion, but the hills need patrolling and I'm short a sentry.<tab>So, are you with us, or against us?<tab>Are you with them, or against them?
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※The recommended level for this FATE is <var 20 E802 /var>.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var><tab><tab><tab><tab>Then might I suggest you get your privileged arse out of my homeland afore I gut you with an imperial pike and make you a martyr.<tab>

The Qalyana will have hidden my necklaces somewhere in their settlement. The cowards fear reprisal and will have thusss fortified their guard. May the Lady of the Blisss guide you true.<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>

Cravens, they are. Each and every lassst one of them! I toil day and night carving humble necklaces for my sisters, only to have them stolen by loathsssome Qalyana as I sleep!<tab>Would that I could retrieve them myssself, yet I am but a carver of beads. You, however, have the look of a <var 08 E905 ((woman)) ((man)) /var> of great merit. Might you win back the items in my stead?<tab>Aid the Vira beadmaid?
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※The recommended level for this FATE is <var 20 E802 /var>.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var><tab><tab>Unworthy am I of your boundlesss charity. May the Lady of the Blisss guide you true through the Qalyana settlement to where the wicked ones keep my things.<tab><tab>This is a matter for the Vira. I cannot fault you for being unwilling or unable to lend your blade. Please, forgive my presumptuousssnesss.<tab>

Yessssss! Those very beads you carry were carved by mine own hand!<tab><tab><tab><tab>Rejoice, my sisters, for this one who treads the land with feet not tail has ressstored unto me that which our foul cousins have stolen! Rejoice!<tab><tab>Those beads were not carved for you and your ilk. They will bring you no fortune. They will bring you no strength.<tab>

Sh-Sh-She came out of n-n-nowhere... Tore privates F-F-Fafapi and Mimipu's limbs right off before s-s-swallowing them whole... Y-Y-You've got to help me... I think it's still out there!<tab>Help the flame scout?
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※The recommended level for this FATE is <var 20 E802 /var>.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var><tab><tab><tab>Praise the Twelve and whoever's listening! You there, pissin' 'bout my beach. Ye look as if ye've time enough to spare. Lend me a hand, like? I'd make it worth yer while. All's ye need to do is keep an eye out fer coral─the redder the better.<tab>Comb the beach for coral?
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※The recommended level for this FATE is <var 20 E802 /var>.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var><tab><tab><tab>O' course ye will! Ne'er met me a 'venturer what weren't lookin' to line <var 08 E905 ((her)) ((his)) /var> purse with a coin or two, and line it I will, iffin ye scrounge me some right comely coral.<tab><tab>Then ye'd best remove yerself from me beach afore I decide I's had enough o' yer bloody front.<tab>

That there be coral in yer purse? I can smell it, I can.<tab><tab><tab><tab>Quite a find, this is. Ye've an eye fer things most beauteous. This piece here'll fetch a pretty zeni o'er in Kugane.<tab><tab>Hand 'em o'er one at a time or all at once. Makes no bloody difference to me.<tab>

Feelin' 'venturous, good 'venturer? Well then might be I'll let ye in on a trade secret. See them crawly coralshells off yonder? The coral on their backs is just as fine, if not finer than the stuff ye'll find lyin' bout the sand. The Dataq are not fighters, but we fight when me must. I have slain many beasts and many more men to see my flock safe.<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>

The automated magitek that roams this city continues to be a thorn in our side.<tab>As we understand it, the safety measures in place to prevent it targeting its own allies were disabled during the civil war, allowing it to attack Garlean troops. Even now, it still treats every living being as a foe.<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>

During my days as an imperial magitek engineer, I sought to simplify the methods for operating the machina used in daily life, so that the average citizen could more easily contribute towards the Empire's technological revolution.<tab>This led me to pursue automation of certain processes, only for my research to be used for military purposes. I had never intended for my work to be used for such destructive ends, and when my protestations fell on deaf ears, I defected to Eorzea.<tab>In my absence, the selfsame technology I created has brought untold misery upon my former compatriots. This automated machina must be stopped, and for that, I require all the information I can gather.<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>

That warmachina was once a manned vehicle, but is now fully automated. The technology I helped create prior to my defection has become the driving force behind that monstrosity, so I must use my knowledge to end this menace once and for all.<tab>By analyzing the parts added to replace a living pilot, I should be able to find a method for deactivating similar machina.<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>

While I'm an officer of the Maelstrom, I'm normally charged with overseeing our armaments and equipment. I'm no stranger to the battlefield, but against an opponent such as this, it's plain to see I'd only get in your way.<tab>Once you've felled the brute, I'll watch Ebrelnaux's back while he retrieves the necessary parts from the wreckage. Best of luck, my friend.<tab><tab><tab><tab><tab><tab>
